page.title: 11MODERN BUILDINGS NEAR BUDE
page.content: Latest buildings are of 2 types, (a) the totally new kind (b) the{renovated kind.New buildings are made of large building blocks of{sand waste}from {china clay}quarries. The walls have a cavity to allow air to circulate. Styles vary considerably though cement rendered{bunglows}are the most common. Windows tend to be large and buildings of this type can be seen at Stibb. {Renovated}buildings are made of local grey and brown{sandstone}and sometimes rendered with cement.The{N {Cornwall Planning and Development {Committee}usually suggest that they have grey{slate}rooves.Windows are of the Cornish small-pane type, and are now commonly stained brown with wood preservative.Such renovations have taken place this year at Lower Halls.
